item.title: Prayer after exercise
item.description: This week Yolandi and I have been getting up early to exercise - we’re on the Joe Wicks 90 day plan. Or at least, she is. And I’m just following along. Monday - Wednesday this week we got up at 06:30 and exercised. After the exercise we were too hot to jump in the shower, and were trying to wait a little while after the exercise to eat breakfast. So I decided that it was a good time to spend with God.

item.title: Eternity isn't very long
item.description: Have you ever thought about the concept of eternity, or thought about what it must be like to live forever?

item.title: What's Changed?
item.description: I was having a discussion with the awesome staff at Renown Church  about Abraham and how he was recognised as someone loved by God because of his incredible wealth.

item.title: Love, Serve, Disciple
item.description: I’m reading through a book on service called “Connect” by Nelson Searcy .

item.title: A New Chapter Begins
item.description: Today marks the start of a brand new and exciting chapter of my life. For many years now (approx 10 years) I have been serving God.

item.title: The Biker and The Beggar
item.description: A few days ago I saw the perfect expression of how charity can destroy dignity, and how charity does not empower the poor.

item.title: Corfe Castle
item.description: This afternoon we stopped in at Corfe Castle. It’s an old castle that now lies in ruin, but the adjacent Corfe town is absolutely beautiful.

item.title: A Dip at the Durdle Door
item.description:
The alliterative titles are back! Woo hoo!

This morning saw us taking a trip out the the Durdle Door. It’s a natural limestone archway right on the coast in the middle of a pair of beautiful beaches.

item.title: Touch down in the UK!
item.description: And we have arrived! Gaby and I are safe and sound in the UK. We arrived a few minutes early, made our way through passport control, baggage claim and customs without issue.

item.title: Transfer in Doha
item.description: We’ve arrived safely in Doha and now sit and wait for our next flight. I really enjoyed the first flight - the Boeing 787 is a beautiful aircraft and a pleasant flight.

item.title: London Bound...Again!
item.description: Once again I’m off to London! A few hours ago I climbed aboard my Qatar flight toward London with the primary purpose of attending my friend’s (Taryn’s) wedding.

item.title: Outside In
item.description: We had a great prayer meeting at the Renown Church , Edenvale Campus on Wednesday morning (2015-05-27.) We prayed about a number of things, but there was something that really stood out to me.

item.title: An Idol in My Life
item.description: Last week Matt preached an incredibly challenging and inspiring message entitled “My Plus One is Different From Me”. If you haven’t heard it, I’d suggest that you give it a listen.

item.title: Life is Unfair! I've had enough!
item.description: Life is unfair. We all know that. And I’ve actually had enough of being put down by the unfairness that is inherent of life!

item.title: Zambia! July 2014
item.description: For many years now I’ve wanted to go on a mission trip with my church, Highway Church . A few years ago I had planned to go and started the process, but ultimately could not go.

item.title: Travel Technology
item.description: My friends were scheduled to land at 06:35, but their flight was running about 20 minutes early. Not a problem though - my bus was due to arrive early and I was at the airport just a bit after 06:25.

item.title: But He loves them anyway
item.description: On Friday night (Good Friday, 18/04/2014) we held a stay awake for the youth of Highway Church; Double Impact. One of our late-night activities was to hold a Tenebrae service.

item.title: Are your priorities prioritised?
item.description: If you had to ask God what makes one person a better Christian than another, what do you think He would say?

item.title: Does God always give back?
item.description: A little while ago God challenged me to start giving more money as an offering to Him. It started with one project’s wage, but God soon prompted me to give Him a whole lot more - basically everything that wasn’t my regular, base income was to go to God.

item.title: The night God cancelled church
item.description: Every Sunday evening we have our evening campus at Highway Church. It’s usually a small gathering, but definitely one of my favourites, just like every other Highway gathering.

item.title: Could you have the next big app?
item.description: Apple announced that in 2013 the App Store did over $10 billion in turnover, with over $1 billion in December 2013 alone.

item.title: A skewed view of "mutually beneficial"
item.description: When I started my new job my boss gave me a new laptop.

item.title: Value: What matters to you?
item.description:
The Story

Things at home are changing, and part of that change was moving a bunch of stuff out the house. Some of that stuff is alcohol, something I hate. It’s standing on the dining room table at the moment, and I ask why it hadn’t been thrown out yet.

item.title: South Africa vs England - 16 June 2012
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_116” align="aligncenter” width="600”]

This is our view as the teams lined up for the nation anthem.[/caption]

item.title: Evangelism Isn't About Saving Everyone
item.description: Ok, it’s a controversial title, but it got you reading, didn’t it? Anyway, this is an idea that I believe God kinda dropped into my heart the other day: Evangelism isn’t about getting everyone saved.

item.title: Be the Church
item.description: I’ve grown up in the church in many ways. Sure, I haven’t always been in church, but for most of my life I’ve been exposed to a traditional church setting. We’ve been going through two series at church, and both have been radically challenging my idea of church.

item.title: What it means to be a Christian
item.description: When I woke up this morning my first thought was “Why are you going to church this morning?”

item.title: Why UniekLee?
item.description: So why would I go and change my screen name from leew4jc to UniekLee? Well, there are a number of reasons, so I thought I would explain.

You can ready about why I chose to do this in my blog post, Why UniekLee? One of the things that comes with a rebranding is a new logo. I know what you’re thinking - you’re a human being, why do you need a logo? Well, I don’t. I have no use for one at all. But I want one: it’s cool, it’s fun, it’s something that I enjoy.Now when it comes to designing a logo, I have very strong beliefs about what a logo should be.
